botanical_details.genus: Solanum can be annuals, perennials, evergreen or deciduous shrubs or twining climbers, with simple or pinnnately lobed leaves and star- or bowl-shaped, 5-lobed flowers with prominent stamens, followed by fleshy fruits

how_to_grow.cultivation: Once all danger of frost has passed, plant into greenhouse borders or growbags, or harden plants off and plant outside into rich soil in a sunny spot. Tie into supports and pinch out sidehoots. Keep well-watered and feed weekly with a tomato fertiliser once flowers form. See Tomatoes for further information
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate sowing seed in early spring in a frost-free greenhouse or windowsill
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove side shoots and pinch out the growning tip when the plant has reached the top of the greenhouse, or has set 7 trusses indoors or 4 trusses outdoors
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to glasshouse whitefly
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to grey moulds, tomato blight, tomato viruses and blossom end rot
